examples: The euphemism cycle continues.
that is not a euphemism.
That sounds like a euphemism.
And that's not a euphemism for anything.
So we still use euphemisms around the world to describe the fact that half of all people between puberty and middle age have blood and other fluids flow from their vaginas for a few days each month.
words.defineEn: a word or expression that is used instead of a harsh or insulting one in order to be more tactful and polite
words.defineVi: một từ hoặc cách diễn đạt được sử dụng thay vì một từ gay gắt hoặc xúc phạm để trở nên khéo léo và lịch sự hơn
có một âm thanh dễ chịu
bất kỳ âm thanh dễ chịu (dễ chịu và hài hòa)

examples: Elevated levels of endorphins contribute to the euphoria and relaxation associated with alcohol consumption.
But the euphoria, the joy, the holiday and the celebration, they were over by the end of the year.
There was a lot of euphoria in the square when I was released from prison.
Ketamine is perhaps best known as a party drug since taking it can induce euphoria, a sense of peace and serenity, and an altered perception of reality.
For centuries, societies have coveted opioids for the euphoria and the pain relief they provide.
words.defineEn: a feeling of intense happiness, excitement, or pleasure
words.defineVi: một cảm giác hạnh phúc mãnh liệt, phấn khích, hoặc niềm vui

examples: I was euphoric.
Beijing was euphoric.
And that night, it was euphoric.
But, based on my experience in my office, Bipolar 1 Disorder can feel good at times because mania can be a little euphoric.
But these euphoric episodes exceed ordinary feelings of joy, causing troubling symptoms like racing thoughts, sleeplessness, rapid speech, impuslive actions, and risky behaviors.
words.defineEn: exaggerated feeling of well-being or elation
words.defineVi: cảm giác hạnh phúc hoặc phấn chấn quá mức

examples: Only 48 out of 50 states required unanimity to convict in criminal trials until 2018.
WILLIAM BRANGHAM: I should say, for all of the celebration today, there isn't total unanimity in the black community about this.
Despite the differences on the Palestinians, is there unanimity about how to handle the Biden administration, especially when it comes to the Iran nuclear deal?
But I don’t see, from right away, a kind of unanimity like you had.
Well, I don't disagree, but I would add that at least there's a consensus now, if not unanimity, that this is a serious, grave national calamity.
words.defineEn: a situation in which all those involved are in complete agreement on something
words.defineVi: một tình huống trong đó tất cả những người liên quan đều hoàn toàn đồng ý về một cái gì đó

examples: But that would take unanimous consent.
But today's unanimous decision does not address whether that includes salaries for athletes.
There was not a unanimous consent we should do that plan.
The New York Tribune reported, "The unanimous sentiment of the North is indignant resistance."
The articles could be amended, but that required a unanimous vote, so zero amendments were ever passed.
words.defineEn: (of a group) fully in agreement on something
words.defineVi: (của một nhóm) hoàn toàn đồng ý về một cái gì đó

examples: Their arrogant attitude is what really made my hackles rise.
The CEO's promotion to a higher position brought out a more arrogant side of him, demonstrating how honors change manners.
The arrogant CEO refused to alter his unrealistic deadline despite mounting evidence of its impracticality, demonstrating that he was a fool, as a wise man changes his mind, a fool never.
They trade pragmatic advice, friendly jokes and not-so-friendly barbs about their arrogant peers.
It was to me, arrogant to see this gift and then let it die.
words.defineEn: having a proud, unpleasant attitude toward others and showing an exaggerated sense of self-importance
words.defineVi: có thái độ tự hào, khó chịu với người khác và thể hiện thái độ tự trọng quá mức

words.defineEn: demand as being one's due or property; assert one's right or title to
words.defineVi: yêu cầu như là do hoặc tài sản của một người; khẳng định quyền hoặc tiêu đề của một người

words.defineEn: marked by a ready flow of speech
words.defineVi: được đánh dấu bằng một luồng lời nói sẵn sàng

examples: Voluminous is crucial in beauty.
The human buttock is the most voluminous in the animal kingdom.
I learned a new word, "voluminous."
- We want bigger, more voluminous lashes, - we gotta get 'em-- - Of course.
words.defineVi: số lượng lớn hoặc số lượng lớn

examples: Not to mention its cars' enormous dimensions and Dagmar bumpers, nicknamed after the voluptuous TV star.
words.defineEn: (of a woman's body) curvy and attractive with full breasts and wide hips
words.defineVi: (của cơ thể phụ nữ) cong và hấp dẫn với bộ ngực đầy đặn và hông rộng

examples: It's hard to trust someone who has a history of deceit because a fox may grow grey, but never good.
I have repeatedly used deceit to cheat, con, or defraud others for my personal gain.
Well, I'm sick of all of the deceit and I'm sick of all of the lies.
For it was Loki’s deceit that had brought them these fine treasures and given Thor the hammer for which he’s still known today.
Taking his brother’s awl, he pierced it through Loki’s lips and sewed his mouth shut, so the trickster god could no longer spread his malicious deceit.
He always presented himself as honest and trustworthy, and because he believed in the saying 'be what you would seem to be,' he never lied or acted in a deceitful manner.
Your entire being is deceitful.
Someone with Conduct Disorder is really deceitful.
In the early 2000s, low interest rates and deceitful lending practices encouraged more people to buy homes.
I thought that they were being really horrifically deceitful, manipulative, harming other people.
words.defineEn: marked by deliberate deceptiveness especially by pretending one set of feelings and acting under the influence of another

examples: He always warned his friends to be cautious of women, saying that the female of the species is more deadly than the male and that they should never underestimate a woman's ability to manipulate and deceive.

Do my eyes deceive me?
'I do not deceive people!
And you can deceive.

words.defineVi: để làm cho một người tin rằng một cái gì đó không đúng sự thật

examples: "The disorders typically manifest early in development often before the child enters grade school" so very young.

And that manifests itself in lots of different ways.

words.defineEn: to display something, such as a feeling, attitude, or quality
words.defineVi: để hiển thị một cái gì đó, chẳng hạn như một cảm giác, thái độ, hoặc chất lượng

examples: So you have these manifolds all over the boat.

We have the impression that the Turkish leadership is deliberately trying to lead relations between Russia and Turkey into deadlock.
